DOCNAME: CASE OF ÖZCAN KORKMAZ  AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Kristina Pardalos;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were all former members of ORG , who had been discharged for disciplinary reasons .
CARDINAL . The applicants brought separate proceedings before ORG , requesting the annulment of their discharge .

CARDINAL . ORG held , after hearing the parties ( except in application no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL where no hearing was held ) and examining the confidential documents submitted by ORG by virtue of LAW no . DATE , that the applicants ' discharges had been in conformity with the applicable laws . Consequently , it rejected their annulment requests . Neither the written opinion of the principal public prosecutor submitted to ORG prior to the hearings , nor the comments of the reporting judge which were entertained during the deliberations , were communicated to the applicants .
CARDINAL . The applicants subsequently requested the rectification of ORG decisions . Their requests were rejected on DATE :
- application no . CARDINAL : DATE ( decision served on the applicant on DATE )

CARDINAL . A description of the relevant domestic law can be found in the decision of GPE v. GPE ( ( dec . ) , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , DATE ) . In particular , LAW no . CARDINAL on ORG provides as follows :

“ Prosecutors shall examine the files assigned to them on behalf of ORG and shall give their written reasoned opinions on [ his or her ] behalf within DATE at the latest in proceedings [ on the merits ] ... [ They ] shall perform other tasks assigned by the President and ORG ...
Prosecutors may demand , through the President , all types of information and files from the relevant authorities .
Where deemed necessary by ORG , prosecutors may [ be asked to ] express their opinions orally ... ”
CARDINAL . Provisional LAW no . DATE provides as follows in respect of the functions of the reporting judge :
“ ... Rapporteurs shall duly examine the cases assigned to them by the Presidents of the Chamber[s ] and shall provide the ORG or ORG with the necessary explanations .

[ The rapporteurs ] shall give their ORG ] and conclusions orally and in writing , shall write draft judgments , [ and ] draw up the necessary minutes . [ They ] shall perform other tasks assigned by the President or the President of the Chamber[s ] . ”
